intro: Eriospermum schinzii, commonly known as the Schinz's eriosperm, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant features a short, thick caudex and produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically linear and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Eriospermum schinzii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
